item.title: Backup Your Gmail and Google Apps While You Can
item.description: A lot of us utilize Gmail and other Google services for work due to their ease of use and affordability. However, a major drawback is the lack of robust data recovery options in case of accidental deletions or other mishaps. Imagine accidentally deleting crucial contact information from your Gmail account. Without a backup, that data would be lost forever. While Google doesn’t provide a native backup solution, third-party services like Backupify bridge the gap.

item.title: Bonded T1 Solution Increases Bandwidth
item.description: A 1.5 Mbps T1 bandwidth has long been a standard for small businesses, often proving sufficient for their needs. Some businesses even utilize an Integrated T1 solution for combined internet and telephone services. However, as bandwidth demands increase, many find T1 bandwidth limiting their productivity. A simple solution to increase bandwidth is adding a second T1 line, doubling it to 3 Mbps. However, for these lines to function as a single, larger line, they should be ordered from the same provider with a “bonded T1 solution.

item.title: Fractional and Full Gigabit Ethernet Options
item.description: By: John Shepler Modern applications require increasingly high bandwidth. A 10 Mbps connection, considered entry-level, is often insufficient for businesses. Many need at least 100 Mbps WAN bandwidth to support real-time applications like VoIP and video conferencing, as well as latency-sensitive cloud connections. This ensures optimal performance even during peak usage. Larger businesses and those with technology-heavy needs might even require Gigabit connections, which are now readily available and more affordable than in the past.
